tool.help:
**What it does**
Run hierarchical clustering on gene expression data or differential expression analysis and diplay correponding heatmap.
.. class:: warningmark
**SANDBOX TOOL** this program is still in developement
-----
**Parameters**
\- **Title** to personalize output file names (please avoid special characters and blanks).
\- **Data to cluster**
- **Expression data**
- **Differential expression analysis results**
\- **Probes/genes filtering**
- **Filtering before clustering**
- **Filtering after clustering**
\- **Filter**
- **From differential expression analysis**
\- **Differential expression results file**
\- **Reference contrast**
\- **Fold change threshold**
\- **FDR-val threshold**
- **From list of genes/probes**
\- **Gene list file**
-----
**Advanced parameters**
\- **Cluster number** fixed for hierarchical clustering. Use generated screeplot to adjust this number and re-run clustering.
\- **Cluster samples** allow to apply clustering on samples additionnaly to genes/probes clustering. If you want to keep sample order for visualization purposes, you should disable this option. Sample clusters will not appear (yet) in output text file.
\- **Max. gene/probe number** : for readability and running time, number of displayed rows in heatmaps (genes/probes) can be limited, clustering and scree plot are still computed for all rows but heatmaps are displayed for a random selection of original data. To avoid such random selection we advise you to use input filtering option.
\- **Personalized color** to build color gradient choosing start, middle and end colors.
\- **Output format** for heatmap plots.
\- **Html snapshot format** for interactive plotly plots.
-----
**Outputs**
\- **Tabular clustering file** containing
\- **Heatmap** when number of gene to display in heatmap exceed 1.000, random sampling is done for plotting efficiency, in this case clustering displayed may differ from clustering information contained in table as heatmap clustering is done over 1.000 samples maximum whereas a global clustering is done for table content
\- **LOG file** containing information about execution. Useful especially if tool execution fail. Please attach this log file in any bug report.
